testCases.title: Dashboard Data Visualization
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality of the dashboard visualizations, including charts, graphs, and numerical indicators displaying call and case data.
testCases.expectedResult: Dashboard should accurately display current data in various visualization formats with proper labeling and accurate counts.

steps.stepDescription: Login to the system with valid credentials.
steps.expectedResult: User should be successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the dashboard or main reporting section.
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard should load with various visualization elements.
Pie chart should display case distribution by category with accurate counts.

steps.stepDescription: Verify Case per Location pie chart.
steps.expectedResult: Pie chart should display case distribution by location with accurate counts.
Chart should display daily case counts over time.
Case status section should show accurate counts of ongoing and closed cases.
Priority distribution should show accurate counts of cases by priority level.

steps.stepDescription: Check that total counts match across different visualizations.
steps.expectedResult: Total case count should be consistent across all dashboard elements.

steps.stepDescription: Verify all visualization elements have proper labels and legends.
steps.expectedResult: All charts and graphs should have clear labels, legends, and tooltips if applicable.
Dashboard should adapt appropriately to different screen sizes.

testCases.title: Dashboard Date Range Filtering
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to filter dashboard data by different date ranges and time periods.
testCases.expectedResult: Dashboard data should update correctly based on the selected date range filters.

steps.expectedResult: Dashboard should load with default date range.

steps.stepDescription: Verify the default date range display.
steps.expectedResult: Current date range should be displayed (e.g., "This Month" with specific dates).

steps.stepDescription: Click on the date range dropdown.
steps.expectedResult: Date range options should appear.
Dashboard should update to show data for the current month.

steps.stepDescription: Verify data consistency after filter change.
steps.expectedResult: All visualizations should update to reflect the selected date range.

steps.stepDescription: Select a different date range option.
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard should update to show data for the previous month.

steps.stepDescription: Test custom date range selection if available.
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard should update to show data for the custom date range.

steps.stepDescription: Verify that total counts update appropriately.
steps.expectedResult: Total counts should reflect only data within the selected date range.

steps.stepDescription: Test the date navigation controls if available.
steps.expectedResult: Navigation controls should allow moving to previous/next time periods.
Dashboard should return to default date range display.

testCases.title: Case Type Filtering
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to filter dashboard data by case types (VAC, GBV, or both).
testCases.expectedResult: Dashboard data should update correctly based on the selected case type filters.

steps.expectedResult: Dashboard should load with default case type filter.

steps.stepDescription: Verify the default case type filter display.
steps.expectedResult: Current case type filter should be displayed (e.g., "Both VAC & GBV").

steps.stepDescription: Click on the case type dropdown.
steps.expectedResult: Case type options should appear.
Dashboard should update to show data for both VAC and GBV cases.

steps.stepDescription: Verify data consistency after filter change.
steps.expectedResult: All visualizations should update to reflect the selected case types.
Dashboard should update to show data for VAC cases only.

steps.stepDescription: Verify data consistency after filter change.
steps.expectedResult: All visualizations should update to reflect VAC cases only.
Dashboard should update to show data for GBV cases only.

steps.stepDescription: Verify data consistency after filter change.
steps.expectedResult: All visualizations should update to reflect GBV cases only.

steps.stepDescription: Reset to default case type filter.
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard should return to default case type filter.

testCases.title: Chart Type Switching
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to switch between different chart types for data visualization.
testCases.expectedResult: Charts should correctly change type while maintaining the same data representation.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the dashboard or reports section.
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard should load with default chart types.

steps.stepDescription: Locate the chart type selector for a specific chart (e.g., X-Axis, Y-Axis options).
steps.expectedResult: Chart type selector should be available.

steps.stepDescription: Identify and verify current chart type.
steps.expectedResult: Current chart type should be displayed or indicated.

steps.stepDescription: Switch to "Pie Chart" type if not already selected.
steps.expectedResult: Chart should change to pie chart format while maintaining the same data.

steps.stepDescription: Verify data consistency after chart type change.
steps.expectedResult: Data represented should be the same as before, just in a different format.

steps.stepDescription: Switch to "Bar Chart" type if available.
steps.expectedResult: Chart should change to bar chart format.

steps.stepDescription: Switch to "Line Chart" type if available.
steps.expectedResult: Chart should change to line chart format.

steps.stepDescription: Test chart-specific options if available (e.g., stacked bars).
steps.expectedResult: Chart-specific options should modify the visualization accordingly.
Legends should update to match the current chart type.
Chart should return to default type.

testCases.title: Time Period Granularity Selection
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to change the time period granularity (e.g., year, month, week, day, hour) for time-based charts.
testCases.expectedResult: Time-based charts should update to display data at the selected granularity level.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the dashboard or reports section with time-based charts.
steps.expectedResult: Time-based charts should be visible with default granularity.

steps.stepDescription: Locate the X-Axis options for time granularity.
steps.expectedResult: X-Axis options should be available (Year, Month, Week, Day, Hourly).
Chart should update to show data aggregated by year.

steps.stepDescription: Verify data aggregation at yearly level.
steps.expectedResult: Data should be correctly aggregated and displayed by year.
Chart should update to show data aggregated by month.
Chart should update to show data aggregated by week.
Chart should update to show data aggregated by day.
Chart should update to show data aggregated by hour.
X-axis labels should reflect the selected time granularity.

steps.stepDescription: Verify data consistency across different granularities.
steps.expectedResult: Total values should remain consistent regardless of granularity.

testCases.title: Call Statistics Reporting
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to view and analyze call statistics reports, including call volumes, durations, and dispositions.
testCases.expectedResult: Call statistics reports should accurately display call data with appropriate filtering and grouping options.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the call statistics or reports section.
steps.expectedResult: Call statistics reports should load.
Call volume metrics should show accurate counts of calls by type.
Call duration metrics should show accurate average, min, and max durations.
Call disposition breakdown should show accurate counts by disposition type.

steps.stepDescription: Test filtering call data by date range.
steps.expectedResult: Report should update to show data for the selected date range.

steps.stepDescription: Test filtering call data by agent if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: Report should update to show data for the selected agent.

steps.stepDescription: Test grouping call data by different dimensions.
steps.expectedResult: Report should update to group data by the selected dimension.
Report should export in the specified format.

steps.stepDescription: Verify call statistics visualizations if available.
steps.expectedResult: Visualizations should accurately represent the call data.
Totals and averages should be calculated correctly.

testCases.title: Case Statistics Reporting
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to view and analyze case statistics reports, including case volumes, categories, statuses, and resolution times.
testCases.expectedResult: Case statistics reports should accurately display case data with appropriate filtering and grouping options.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the case statistics or reports section.
steps.expectedResult: Case statistics reports should load.
Case volume metrics should show accurate counts of cases.
Case category breakdown should show accurate counts by category.
Case status breakdown should show accurate counts by status.
Case priority breakdown should show accurate counts by priority level.

steps.stepDescription: Test filtering case data by date range.
steps.expectedResult: Report should update to show data for the selected date range.

steps.stepDescription: Test filtering case data by agent/owner if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: Report should update to show data for the selected owner.

steps.stepDescription: Test grouping case data by different dimensions.
steps.expectedResult: Report should update to group data by the selected dimension.
Report should export in the specified format.

steps.stepDescription: Verify case lifecycle metrics if available.
steps.expectedResult: Lifecycle metrics (time to resolve, etc.) should be calculated correctly.

testCases.title: Report Download Functionality
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to download reports in various formats (e.g., CSV, Excel, PDF).
testCases.expectedResult: Reports should be successfully downloaded in the specified format with all relevant data included.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to a report or data view with download functionality.
steps.expectedResult: Report should load with download option visible.
Download options should appear if multiple formats are available.
Report should download in CSV format.
CSV file should contain all relevant data with proper formatting.
Report should download in Excel format.
Excel file should contain all relevant data with proper formatting.
Report should download in PDF format.
PDF file should contain all relevant data with proper formatting.

steps.stepDescription: Test downloading with different filters applied.
steps.expectedResult: Downloaded report should reflect the applied filters.

steps.stepDescription: Test downloading large datasets if applicable.
steps.expectedResult: Large datasets should download completely without errors.

testCases.title: Custom Report Creation
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to create custom reports with user-defined metrics, filters, and visualizations.
testCases.expectedResult: Custom reports should be successfully created with the specified parameters and display accurate data.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the custom report creation section if available.
steps.expectedResult: Custom report creation interface should load.

steps.stepDescription: Initiate creating a new custom report.
steps.expectedResult: New report configuration interface should appear.
Name and description should be saved.

steps.stepDescription: Select data source or report type.
steps.expectedResult: Data source should be selected.
Selected metrics should be added to the report.
Filters should be configured.
Grouping should be configured.
Visualization should be configured.
Report should be saved successfully.
Report should execute and display accurate results.

testCases.title: Scheduled Report Delivery
testCases.description: This test case verifies the functionality to schedule automatic report generation and delivery.
testCases.expectedResult: Reports should be automatically generated and delivered according to the specified schedule.

steps.stepDescription: Navigate to the report scheduling section if available.
steps.expectedResult: Report scheduling interface should load.
Report should be selected.
Frequency should be configured.
Schedule details should be configured.
Delivery method should be configured.
Recipients should be configured.
Format should be configured.
Schedule should be saved successfully.

steps.stepDescription: Verify the scheduled report appears in the list.
steps.expectedResult: Scheduled report should be visible in the list.

steps.stepDescription: Verify report is delivered according to schedule (may require waiting).
steps.expectedResult: Report should be delivered at the scheduled time.
